comment.body: I used mpc which is a frontend to mpd (music player daemon). The cool thing is that there are a ton of frontends to mpd (mobile, web, GUI, console)

I have used an aquaris for about 20 months so far. It is very pleasant to use. You get used to the web apps, aven if I would prefer native apps. The only thing that really bothers me is that syncing contacts and calendar still has to be performed at the commandline. But I read that the next update should contain a GUI for that.

@Mynameislegion: I don't use these services, so I don't know. What I do know is that podcasts work well wether downloaded or streamed with the podbird app. With a recent upgrade, some VPN settings were added to the configuration GUI. I don't know how easy it is to install TOR on it. If everything else fails, you can always run stuff in a chroot on the commandline.
